chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type

Goal:
pos 0 -> X

Premises:
Notation pos := Fin.t
pos_O_invert : forall X : Type, pos 0 -> X
Fin.case0 : forall (P : pos 0 -> Type) (p : pos 0), P p
FinFun.Fin2Restrict.restrict : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), FinFun.bFun n f -> pos n -> pos n
pos_iso : forall n m : nat, n = m -> pos n -> pos m
pos_S_invert : forall (n : nat) (P : pos (S n) -> Type), P pos0 -> (forall p : pos n, P (pos_nxt p)) -> forall p : pos (S n), P p
Fin.weak : forall p : nat, (pos ?m -> pos ?n) -> pos (p + ?m) -> pos (p + ?n) where ?m : [X : Type |- nat] ?n : [X : Type |- nat]
Fin.rect2 : forall P : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos n -> Type, (forall n : nat, P (S n) pos0 pos0) -> (forall (n : nat) (f : pos n), P (S n) pos0 (pos_nxt f)) -> (forall (n : nat) (f : pos n), P (S n) (pos_nxt f) pos0) -> (forall (n : nat) (f g : pos n), P n f g -> P (S n) (pos_nxt f) (pos_nxt g)) -> forall (n : nat) (a b : pos n), P n a b
Fin.caseS' : forall (p : pos (S ?n)) (P : pos (S ?n) -> Type), P pos0 -> (forall p0 : pos ?n, P (pos_nxt p0)) -> P p where ?n : [X : Type |- nat]
FinFun.Fin2Restrict.extend : forall n : nat, (pos n -> pos n) -> nat -> nat
Fin.cast : pos ?m -> forall n : nat, ?m = n -> pos n where ?m : [X : Type |- nat]
Fin.t_rect : forall P : forall n : nat, pos n -> Type, (forall n : nat, P (S n) pos0) -> (forall (n : nat) (t : pos n), P n t -> P (S n) (pos_nxt t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : pos n), P n t
Fin.t_sind : forall P : forall n : nat, pos n -> SProp, (forall n : nat, P (S n) pos0) -> (forall (n : nat) (t : pos n), P n t -> P (S n) (pos_nxt t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : pos n), P n t
Fin.t_ind : forall P : forall n : nat, pos n -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P (S n) pos0) -> (forall (n : nat) (t : pos n), P n t -> P (S n) (pos_nxt t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : pos n), P n t
Fin.t_rec : forall P : forall n : nat, pos n -> Set, (forall n : nat, P (S n) pos0) -> (forall (n : nat) (t : pos n), P n t -> P (S n) (pos_nxt t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : pos n), P n t
Fin.rectS : forall P : forall n : nat, pos (S n) -> Type, (forall n : nat, P n pos0) -> (forall (n : nat) (p : pos (S n)), P n p -> P (S n) (pos_nxt p)) -> forall (n : nat) (p : pos (S n)), P n p
Fin.caseS : forall P : forall n : nat, pos (S n) -> Type, (forall n : nat, P n pos0) -> (forall (n : nat) (p : pos n), P n (pos_nxt p)) -> forall (n : nat) (p : pos (S n)), P n p
FinFun.Fin2Restrict.extend_ok : forall (n : nat) (f : pos n -> pos n), FinFun.bFun n (FinFun.Fin2Restrict.extend f)
Inductive t : nat -> Set := F1 : forall n : nat, pos (S n) | FS : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos (S n) Arguments Fin.t _%nat_scope Arguments Fin.F1 {n}%nat_scope Arguments Fin.FS {n}%nat_scope
FinFun.Fin2Restrict.extend_f2n : forall (n : nat) (f : pos n -> pos n) (x : pos n), FinFun.Fin2Restrict.extend f (FinFun.Fin2Restrict.f2n x) = FinFun.Fin2Restrict.f2n (f x)
Fin.of_nat_lt = fix of_nat_lt (p n : nat) {struct p} : p < n -> pos n := match n as n0 return (p < n0 -> pos n0) with | 0 => fun H : p < 0 => False_rect (pos 0) (Nat.nlt_0_r p H) | S n' => match p as p0 return (p0 < S n' -> pos (S n')) with | 0 => fun _ : 0 < S n' => pos0 | S p' => fun H : S p' < S n' => pos_nxt (of_nat_lt p' n' (lt_S_n p' n' H)) end end : forall p n : nat, p < n -> pos n Arguments Fin.of_nat_lt {p n}%nat_scope
FinFun.Fin2Restrict.extend_surjective : forall (n : nat) (f : pos n -> pos n), FinFun.bSurjective n (FinFun.Fin2Restrict.extend f) < -> FinFun.Surjective f
FinFun.Fin2Restrict.extend_injective : forall (n : nat) (f : pos n -> pos n), FinFun.bInjective n (FinFun.Fin2Restrict.extend f) < -> FinFun.Injective f
Fin.L_R : forall n : nat, pos ?m -> pos (n + ?m) where ?m : [X : Type |- nat]
Fin.L : forall n : nat, pos ?m -> pos (?m + n) where ?m : [X : Type |- nat]
Fin.R : forall n : nat, pos ?m -> pos (n + ?m) where ?m : [X : Type |- nat]
